Name: For the Girls: First Expansion
Description: Includes: 180 new cards to be added to the main For the Girls game. Contains new game cards from the 5 different colored decks (pink, blue, purple, orange and green).

Name: Goblin Civil War
Description:
A bit like the Spanish civil war but with goblins!
characterful easy to paint miniatures, plus a easy to pick up unit-based system, filled with lots of hard choices.
plays out in 2-3 hours

Its a classic 28mm scale, platoon VS platoon wargame 30-50 models a side with a emphasis on infantry, you are fighting for control of objectives and victory points.

The setting is inspired by the Spanish civil war but we have played around with the factions slightly and added units for reasons of game balance and flavour that were not in the real SCW.

Name: The Perfect Gift
Description:
Have you ever hoped for a voice-activated armadillo launcher? Or perhaps some invisible jelly bean repellent? And should you get your sister that heat-seeking butterfly cleaner she has always wanted? Well, now you can practice finding that special something for your special someone.

The Perfect Gift is a family-friendly party game for 2 to 6 imaginative players.

Each turn, one player is the lucky recipient. They select one card from their hand to represent the theme of the gifts that they wish for. The other players choose two further cards from their own hand to create an anonymous three part description of a gift - perhaps cute 'n cuddly boa constrictor slippers, or an oversized chocolate-coated snapping turtle. The players all discuss and debate the merits of each gift, and then the recipient chooses which one they would most like to receive. Whoever created that gift gets a point, and the next person becomes the recipient. The game ends after a fixed number of rounds and the person with the most points wins.

Name: Pilgrimage: Start your journey
Description:
Go on a journey through Europe for the most beautiful pilgrimages. 
Create your own route and be the first to visit the most beautiful places. Choose the right means of transport and outsmart your fellow players. Go on foot, by plane or with the boat. Collect as many holy objects as possible to earn some extra points. Choose the fastest route, and be the first player to collect 12 shells and win the game!

Pilgrimage is a 2 to 4 player game that takes about 45 minutes to play. Players make a pilgrimage in search of beautiful pilgrimage places. To prove that they have reached one, they collect route tokens. With these route tokens, players commemorate their pilgrimage. Use boats and planes to speed up your journey and collect artifacts to make your commemoration worth more points. Which of your family or friends makes the largest pilgrimage?

During the game, players use the cards in their hands to move around the board. Each turn you play one card that indicates how many steps you're allowed to move forward. When you reach one of the four destination that are shown in the top corner of the board, you may pick that tile an place it in front of you. Players instantly receive the shells shown on the tile. Keep in mind that the tiles should always fit in your collection by connecting the lines, if not, you cannot collect them. Players also have personal powers and ways to bother their opponents. The first player to collect 12 shells wins the game.

Name: Peaky Blinders: Shelby Company Trading
Description:
1920’s Birmingham, an era of gang warfare. But war never goes without business.

In this Peaky Blinders game, players become employees of the Shelby Company Limited. Run your part of the business in Birmingham, London and other surrounding areas. Gather your products and sell them on the market to the highest bidder. To master this strategic card game, players will need to be able to guess the amount of bids they will win. High value products will not win you the game. Bluff, think-forward and manage your stock to become The wealthiest gangster in the UK!

Peaky Blinders Shelby Company Trading is a small tactical board game with players receive 10 cards to play 10 rounds with. It's possible to win a round by placing the highest card on the table, but it's not about winning the most rounds. Players guess the amount of rounds they will win, and earn their victory by guessing the most correct rounds. Player lives and player cards make this game a tactical bluffing game for quick card game lovers.

Name: Taalhelden van het spelwoud
Description:
The language heroes (Taalhelden) jump into action to defeat the monsters of the game forest with you. The game forest is full of dangerous creatures that feed on language and only the language heroes can defeat them. Choose your favorite language hero, create your own game forest and work together to defeat the monsters with your language skills!

The educational game can be played at different levels: level 1 from group 4 to level 3 for groups 7 and 8. The game can be played at school or at home and contains a booklet with no less than 60 texts to train your brain.

Players place cards on the table to form a path through the Game Forest. With personal language heroes, they walk the path to find treasure chests and defeat bosses. To defeat bosses, players answer questions related to texts they read. By answering a question correctly, the players earn stars, which are added together at the end of the game to form a high score.
Can you and your team get the best high score? Let the adventure begin!



Kidsweek Taalhelden van het spelwoud is a game about creating an adventure together and slaying monsters with your language skills. Each turn, players place cards to create a route towards boss monsters and treasures. They move on this created route with their heroes to reach treasures and to battle boss monsters. Battling monsters will cost players a live, so they need to collect those lives back by looking for treasures. By answering questions (fighting boss monsters) about the Dutch language, players score stars together. The game ends when the deck of cards runs out. Try to earn a lot of stars to increase your score and set you highscore.

Name: Carnage
Description:
A semi-cooperative board game of terror and violent survival. Inspired by the greatest works of horror, Carnage is a game driven by your choices and your ability to survive against deadly traps, madmen and even your friends. For 2 to 6 players from 14 years old. Filled with Easter eggs from popular horror movies, old and recent, this is a must for the lovers of the genre. There are tons of references to slashers, psychopaths and other villains as well as iconic locations and items.

Each player gets 4 actions to spend during a turn.

To win: 
1. Complete your personal objective
2. Start the power in the Engine Room
3. Unlock the door to the Control Room
4. Get out

Highlights
1. Simple gameplay for an instant immersive experience, while complex in its variables for a great replayability. 
2. Play certain cards at ANY time, including when you are not the active player. 
3. Get through twisted and deadly traps that will certainly test your nerves.
4. Embrace your madness and take advantage of it if you would lose your sanity.
5. If you die, you now play as a Deranged to hunt and kill the other players.

Name: Gates
Description:
An unusual 2-player abstract strategy game. Start the game by placing pieces onto the board — yours or your opponent’s. Then, guide your pieces to the escape gates before your opponent does the same.


OBJECT OF THE GAME
Score all of your Spikes by getting them to your Gates.

MOVEMENT
Players now attempt to move their Spikes to their Gates while blocking their opponent. The last player to place in Placement gets to move first in Movement. On your turn in Movement, pick any one of your Spikes and move it one space in any direction.

Trapezoids can land on enemy spikes to move them to any empty space.
Triangles move two spaces instead of one.

SCORING
When you move one of your Spikes into one of your Gates, the Spike is scored, removing it from the game.
After scoring, your opponent may then relocate the Gate that you just used, placing it on any empty space.
Your Spikes can’t move onto your opponent’s pieces (except for Trapezoids, which can land on enemy Spikes).
Continue moving and scoring Spikes in turns.

Once a player has scored all four of their Spikes, they win!

Name: Dice Plunder
Description:
A jolly game of piracy for 2. Loot cargo from your opponent to upgrade your ships and rule the seas.

The seas are ripe for plunder! Pirates fight for control of cargo and territory, clashing in epic naval battles for supremacy. You and your ragtag fleet of ships encounter another captain on the seas. This means war! Upgrade all your ships from Sloops to the Man O’ War to seize the ocean!

Players move their ships by flipping coins, battling and plundering their way to earn coins.  With these coins, they upgrade their ships.

To win, upgrade all of your ships to Man O’ War. Once all three of your ships are Man O’ War, you drive out your opponent’s fleet and conquer the seas!
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: What Are The Rules Again?
Description: A card game where players start with a core set of rules and come up with the rest of the rules themselves as they play. The game breaks rules into categories, requires one player to act as GM, and provides rule guidelines for new players.

Name: Dastardly
Description: Players play "tactic" cards in order to complete tasks. Tasks grant rewards when completed and are assigned faster as the game progresses. If too many tasks build up, a player is eliminated. Players may chain copies of the card(s) a player plays on their turn. Game encourages players to copy, counter, and steal each others' cards and tasks.

Name: Houdini-Opoly
Description:
Houdini-Opoly is an exciting hero board game for 2-6 players built around the life of one of the most exciting personalities in history.

As you go around the board you will learn about the life of this great icon of the entertainment field, in a fun way. The real estate properties on the board are the actual key places in Houdini's life in chronological order. Each of the property deed cards has additional fun historic information about that particular time and place in Houdini's life. Each time you play you will get different deeds and land on different spots so both the both the enjoyment, and your knowledge about Houdini will increase.

Uses typical Monopoly rules and movement and has 14 tokens.

Name: Шерлок Холмс (Sherlock Holmes)
Description:
In Sherlock Holmes, detectives venture to the darkest parts of London trying to solve one of six different Sherlock Holmes cases.

At the start of the game, each player is given one of the six cases to solve (kept secret). On their turn, players move their detective piece one or two spaces on the board. Travelling from location to location, they collect clues to be the first to solve their case. Once all their clues have been collected, the player must arrest the criminal before the case is finally solved. Once a player has solved a case, every other player has ten turns to solve their case (losing 1 point each turn). The game ends once all players have solved their case (or if the last players have reached -10 points). All players who have solved their case count up their points (from their case tiles and if they successfully found the criminal) and the player with the most points wins.

Name: 迷宮推理 (Labyrinthine Mystery)
Description:
è¿·å®®æŽ¨ç† (Labyrinthine Mystery) is an asynchronous cooperative game for 3 to 5 players. Players are guests who have been invited by the owner of a grand manor on a snowy winter night. While the guests have never met each other before this night, they share one thing in common: they all have their own reasons for hating the owner of the manor and have designs on his death. When the owner turns up dead, everyone realizes that a formal police investigation might end of leading back to their own person…so they decide to resolve it among themselves by collecting evidence to find the murderer concealed amidst their numbers.

If the players can expose the true identity of the murderer and reveal the tricks and weapon he or she used within the time constraints, they win. Oppositely, if the guilty party is able to deceive everyone and go undetected, that person wins the game.

On each turn, a player can chose to either investigate, accuse, or make a final accusation. Every action costs minutes of the player's limited time.

The game ends when all the time is consumed or if the murderer is discovered.

According to the publisher blurb, this version improves on the original Mystery Homes (2018) by adding new murder weapons, tricks, and changes to the scenario. Aspects of the components/box have also been improved based on feedback from the previous game.

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Valkyrie Hero Pack
Description:
Appointed as leader of the legendary Valkyrior by Odin, Brunnhilde defied the All-Father’s wishes by leaving Asgard to join the Avengers. Since that day, she has dedicated herself to the defense of Midgard as the valiant Valkyrie!

As a member of the mighty Valkyrior, Valkyrie charges into battle in this expansion pack, which introduces her as a brand-new playable hero along with her sixteen signature cards. With a pre-built Aggression deck ready to go, you can take a stab at Valkyrie’s dueling-focused gameplay from the moment you open the box. With strong attacks and plenty of stat boosts, this is one Asgardian that you won’t want to mess with!
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Board Royale: The Island – Zombies Expansion Pack
Description:
Dead has decided to take a stroll ! Bizearre experiments of K.R.A.K.E.N. Industries resulted in a verry predictable conclusion ! Battle against the hoarding zombies or just join them !

Sleep with one eye open beacause each zombie will have an unique type, apparel and a mutation to challenge your party !

Name: Board Royale: The Island – Missions Expansion Pack
Description: Ha veyou ever thought about why you have been stranded on this Island ? Everything is part of a big sinister plan set in motion by K.R.A.K.E.N. Industries. They bought you here for ... Job Application.

Name: Board Royale: The Island – Skills II Expansion Pack
Description: The Island is so popular now. It is full of new faces. Skills 2 Expansion comes with brand new 6 unique playable character classes. Like our previous Skills Expansion, each class has their unique set of skills that will change the way you play the game entirely.

Name: Board Royale: The Island – Secret Weapons Expansion Pack
Description: An abandoned K.R.A.K.E.N. High-Tech Vault was discovered. It's full of experimental high-tech weapons for the next-gen items. Plasma cannons, scientific fevices, drones, turrets and they work with a tiny power cell. Some of these devices look otherworldly. Will you be able to get your hands on them ?

Name: Stop
Description:
Each player has 6 playing pieces (corks), he has to get around the game board to the finish. Movement is determined by a die.
If a cork gets to a space with another cork, the later is thrown out and has to beginn anew. There are eight black safe spaces outside the track that can be used to escape ones persuer or to set an ambush. The first player to get all six corks to the finish, wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Venice: Da Vinci's Workshop
Description:
Venice is at war! The Admiral of the Venetian Arsenal calls for help to fill the armouries. In town, a famous artist arrives from Milan, with talk of flying machines…

In Da Vinci’s Workshop, you can visit 2 new locations. At the Venetian Arsenal, meet Admiral Sebastiano Venier and race to complete communal contracts. At Da Vinci’s Workshop, work with Leonardo Da Vinci and use his newest contraptions to navigate the city with unnatural speed!

With a double-sided extended board, Da Vinci’s Workshop can be used to play the base game with or without these new rules, and is compatible with all player counts – including the challenging solo mode!

Name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Huaihai, 1948-1949
Description:
Xuzhou. This city has always been a battleground for strategists. In the past two thousand years, 158 bloody battles have been recorded in history.

In November 1948, a decisive battle of unprecedented scale was about to break out. The number of troops participating in the war exceeded that at any time in the past. The total number of troops invested by the Kuomintang and the Communist Party reached 1.4 million. Compared with other wars in history, it is really not worth it.

With regard to this decisive battle, the strategic objectives of the two sides are different, and they also have two different names. The Kuomintang's expectation of the campaign was that the whole army would guarantee the lifeline of the railway from Xuzhou to Bengbu on the Jinpu line, so it was named "Xubeng battle". Su Yu's plan is to attack Haizhou first and then win the two criteria. Therefore, our side is called "Huaihai Campaign".

In this decisive battle to determine the fate of a country and a nation, the Kuomintang army invested more than 800000 people and the people's Liberation Army invested 600000 people. In the end, 600 thousand destroyed the 800 thousand. Over the years, the war history textbooks of military academies in various countries have called this campaign a "classic war example" and studied it as a major topic. Generation after generation of professional soldiers of different nationalities, different skin colors and different political beliefs are no strangers to this war case. What makes people deeply interested is its process. How did the 600000 people with inferior military strength and equipment defeat the 800000 people with superior military strength and equipment.

Name: ワラドの冒険 拡張＃1 (それぞれの物語) (Adventure of Warado Expansion #1 (Each Story))
Description:
ãƒ¯ãƒ©ãƒ‰ã®å†’é™º æ‹¡å¼µï¼ƒ1 (ãã‚Œãžã‚Œã®ç‰©èªž) Warado no bouken kakuchou #1 (Sorezore no Monogatari) - Adventure Of Warado Expansion #1 (Each Story) is a small expansion deck for the base game Adventure of Warado. The expansion is only for 4 or 5 players. It is not designed for 2 or 3 players.

The deck of 16 events cards is split into two types of 8 cards each, for the first and second part of the game respectively. Each set of 8 cards is shuffled and 4 are dealt face down in a row along the top of the normal adventure section.

As players advance their cubes through the adventures, past the normal first column, the event cards are then triggered. The events for adventures 2-5 need four cubes to be advance, the latter events for adventures 6-9 need only three cubes to be advanced.

Some of the events are immediate, and some will affect scoring at the end of the game. Usually, one player will benefit by an event whilst the rest suffer.
user summary

Name: ワラドの冒険 拡張 ＃2 (魔法陣と東方の精霊)  (Adventure of Warado Expansion # 2 (Magicians and the Spirit of the East))
Description:
ãƒ¯ãƒ©ãƒ‰ã®å†’é™º æ‹¡å¼µ ï¼ƒ2 (é­”æ³•é™£ã¨æ±æ–¹ã®ç²¾éœŠ) Warado no bouken kakuchou # 2 (Mahou-jin to touhou no Seirei) - Adventure of Warado Expansion # 2 (Magicians and the Spirit of the East) is a free to print'n'play expansion to Adventure of Warado. The expansion is for 5 players only, and is printed on A4 sheets.

This expansion offers 7 new cards to add to the base game, 5 magicians to aid your quest, and 2 Spirits, special magical creatures.
user summary

Name: Chronicles of Stampadia
Description:
The reign of Stampadia had thousands of years of history of dangerous places and brave mercenaries before disappearing mysteriously from our globe. But Stampadia monks, generation after generation, managed to document relentlessly the story of every single adventurer, the map of every single dungeon, and the clue of every single mystery in a huge tome called Chronicles Of Stampadia.

We managed to find a damaged copy in an abandoned basement and it looks like that the book is imbued with some kind of magic: the reader can live every page of its story with just two dice, an eraser, and a small token!

We’re trying to recover, translate and digitalize a new page of this book every day on the project website!

Chronicles of Stampadia is a print-and-play adventure game inspired by classic roguelikes, board games, and gamebooks that has a little twist: the map, the enemies, the quests, the mysteries, and the traps are mixed and generated by a computer algorithm, as in a roguelike videogame. On the Chronicles of Stampadia homepage you will find a unique dungeon to download, print, and discover every day.

—description from the designer

Name: Crowded Kitchen: Salt & Pepper Expansion
Description:
The Salt & Pepper Expansion adds additional recipes, stars, and ingredients to the base game, Crowded Kitchen. These cards allow Crowded Kitchen to be played with up to 7 players, 2 more than the base game's player count of 2-5.

The rules and gameplay for the Salt & Pepper Expansion are the same as those for Crowded Kitchen when playing with 4 or 5 players.

Name: Antimateria
Description:
In the distant future, humanity mastered the science of creating antimatter and this enabled a huge leap in prosperity and evolution for the race. Now, in possession of powerful engines powered by this new and virtually inexhaustible fuel, Earth factions seek to claim new homes for themselves in the depths of the galaxy.

Antimateria is a civ/euro game, with a scifi theme and medium interaction in which conflicts occur indirectly between players - disputes over actions, locations and resources.

In Antimateria, each player represents a faction of a future humanity, which has been given a mission to explore the universe to discover new habitable planets. Everyone cooperates for the good of the humanity, but the game is competitive. Resources are public, meaning if you produce, any player can use the resources at the table. The objective is to gain points with the Federation government being the faction with the best performance in 4 categories (technologies, production, colonization and influence).

The mechanic is card driven where players, instead of playing an action for themselves, play an action that can be done by everyone, at the cost of placing their emissaries on the card. Players reveal the cards simultaneously, so each turn the player chooses which one he wants to activate. If the card the player played is activated by another player, he earns Solaris credits. Credits can be used in a variety of ways, from buying resources to activating certain actions. At the end of the game they serve as a wild resource for scoring if not used. Solaris is a management game with a lot of planning.

Colonies are represented by dice and the die value indicates the level of development of the colony. The more developed it is, the more it will generate credits and also colonization points. Tech cards give you unique abilities and also tech points, while building buildings allows you to earn production points and, of course, generate resources. Finally, there are public goals that when achieved allow the player to gain more emissaries to use and give points of influence. At the end of the game, your score is the sum of your 2 lowest tracks, which forces players to invest in all tracks.

Name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Yudong, 1948
Description:
As an expansions, it was listed together with the Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Huaihai, 1948-1949 . It tells the battle between the Kuomintang and the Communist Party in the east of Henan Province in June 1948 before the outbreak of the Huaihai Campaign.

With independent rule book and accessories, it can not only play independently, but also link with Jinan campaign and Huaihai Campaign.

Name: Great Decisive Battle: The Campaign of Jinan, 1948
Description:
Listed together with the Huaihai Campaign, it tells about the  campaign of Jinpu railway middle section in May 1948 and the Jinan Campaign in September 1948.

With independent rule book and accessories, it can not only play independently, but also link with the Eastern Henan campaign and Huaihai Campaign.

Name: Battle of the Sexes
Description:
Battle of the Sexes has 660 questions (220 cards) split between male and female cards. For every question your team answers correctly, a trophy is moved closer to your team's Winner's Circle. Earn three trophies to win.

Each team can use Challenge Tokens. These Tokens could either propel you to an easy victory, or send you backwards. If your team doesn't know the answer to question, but you think the other team doesn’t know the answer either, you can throw the question back at them by playing one of your challenge tokens. If they answer incorrectly, move the trophy towards your side of the board. If they answer correctly, move the trophy towards their side of the board. Each team only has 3 Challenge Tokens.

Name: Personal Space: The Haunted Moon
Description:
The Haunted Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Haunted Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 7:00-8:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: That Spooky Tree
Local Cuisine: Eerie Eats

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

    Benedict Goodwine
    Evilyn Winthrope
    Mallory Earle
    Saul Blackwood

Name: Personal Space: The Amusement Moon
Description:
The Amusement Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Amusement Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 9:00-10:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Giga Glider
Local Cuisine: Dizzy Donuts

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

    Benny Anivilles
    Emmeline Kay
    Finnian Ferry
    Janae Dunkley

Name: Personal Space: The Mall Moon
Description:
The Mall Moon is an expansion for Personal Space and requires the base game to play.

The Mall Moon is a new moon that you can visit during your games of Personal Space.

Orbit: 8:00-9:00 AM/PM
Popular Attraction: Universal Mall
Local Cuisine: Smooth Moves

New Neighbor: You will gain one of four new neighbors:

    Blaze Wolferstan
    Clement Chandler
    Dot Betteridge
    Petronella Parsons

Name: Disney Cookie Swap Card Game
Description:
The fast-paced cookie flipping and finding game! Join all your favorite Disney and Pixar friends for a holiday treat!

Players share and swap cookies from the sheet. When you collect four cards of the same character—DING! They’re done! Pour a glass of milk and enjoy this deliciously fun card game.

Player draws and trade cards on their turn until the deck runs on.

When deck is out, the player with most points (sets) wins.

Name: Disney Princess: Present Party Game
Description: It’s a holiday game of gift-giving fun! The Disney Princesses’ presents are all mixed up. Work together to sort the giant jumble before the party ends. Spin the spinner and pull presents from the bag. Then give and swap to get each gift to the matching Disney Princess! Time runs out when the deck is out - players win if they have matched all presents to princesses.

Name: Boo Hollow: Pumpkin Showdown
Description:
A fun, fast-paced card game featuring the spooky-cute characters from Funko’s Boo Hollow!

Play Pumpkin cards to throw Pumpkins at the other players, but watch out—they can play cards right back! Roll the special die to grab more Pumpkins, or dodge out of the way at the last second! Whoever gets hit with more Pumpkins takes a Hit card. Get hit three times and your out! Who will be the last one standing?

Name: Something Wild! Five Nights At Freddy's: Rockstar Freddy Game
Description:
Something Wild! Five Nights At Freddy’s is a fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring an exclusive collectible Rockstar Freddy POP! figure, as well as your favorite characters from the Five Nights At Freddy’s video games.

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!
Families: Video Game Theme: Five Nights at Freddy's

Name: Something Wild! Peppermint Lane Santa Claus Game
Description:
Something Wild! Peppermint Lane is a fast-paced, light card game for the whole family! Featuring a collectible Santa Claus! figure, as well as your favorite characters from Funko’s Peppermint Lane.Power

Combine Character Cards in sets and runs to score points, just like in Rummy. Use Power Cards to add a fun twist to the classic card gameplay.

Combine multiple Something Wild games to add more character cards, more Pop! figures, and more powers to your game!

Name: Dr. Seuss: Stack with the Cat Game
Description:
It’s a cold, cold, wet day and the Cat in the Hat has come to play! Stack the playthings one by one. But watch out—the Cat is up on a wobbly ball, so don’t let all the playthings fall!

Draw a card. Choose a plaything to stack on the Cat in the Hat. Be careful—don’t make the Cat drop it all!

Players pick from 2 available cards that have items on them to stack on the cat. Players are out when they make the stack topple. The last player in the game wins.

Name: Dr. Seuss: Happy Birthday to You! Game
Description:
Today is your birthday, the Day of All Days, and it’s time to gather friends and family to celebrate with a game! Wake up to the Birthday Bird and travel with him to the wonderful places of Katroo.

Players spin to find out how many spaces they can move and collect colorful presents along the way like birthday cake, rockets, flowers, and more! Once the presents are all gone, it’s time to race back to the Birthday Palace for a celebration. Be the first one to arrive at the Palace and gain bonus stars!

players count up the start on their present cards and, if you have the most stars at the end of the game, you win!

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: French Expansion Deck
Description: This 18-card expansion pack adds Baron St. Castine and the French faction to games of Devil in the Wilderness.

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: Wabanaki Expansion Deck
Description: This 18-card expansion deck adds Madockawando and the Wabanaki Indians to games of Devil in the Wilderness.

Name: La Guerre à Outrance: Grand-Tactical Franco-Prussian Warfare in Miniature
Description:
La Guerre à Outrance is a traditional miniatures game for recreating the larger actions of the Franco-Prussian War in 1870. Players maneuver brigades -- whole armies can be fielded to re-play entire battles over the course of a normal gaming session. It is designed to be a fast-play alternative to other grand-tactical systems, and uses a common basing system for figures. Time, figure, and ground scales are higher, making for shorter, more decisive actions.

The emphasis is on army and corps-level command: the functions of lower-level generals and officers are handled by the system. This speeds play, and lets players focus on commanding armies instead of regiments or brigades. The game does not use dice, and allows one or more players to use a device to moderate play. The interface is simple and easy to use.

The system is built on a large body of research into the weapons, formations, and doctrine of the period, hiding this complexity to let players experience a more detailed level of simulation in a fast-play format. So go ahead and discover what it is like to fight war to the uttermost, in the most decisive European conflict of the later 19th century!

—description from the publisher

Name: Code 3: Cover Now Officers Pack
Description: The Cover Now Officers Pack features six tough-as-nails beat cops to use in your game of Code 3. Expand your roster with some of the most hard charging officers and detectives that the department has to offer.

Name: Dune: Imperium – Duncan, Loyal Blade Promo Card
Description:
A promo card offered by Dire Wolf to customers who pre-ordered the Dune: Imperium - Deluxe Upgrade Pack.

Is included in Dune Imperium Promo Pack 1

Agent Ability: Recruit a troop.

Reveal ability: Gain one persuasion and two battle points.
When this card is trashed -> Deploy or retreat any number of your troops from or to your garrison.

Name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield – Evolving Skies
Description:
Feel the power of the shifting winds, and brace for an epic storm as mighty Dragon-type Pokémon make their triumphant return! Rayquaza VMAX leads the surge from on high, and Duraludon VMAX towers above the land in its Gigantamax form, joined by Dragonite V, Noivern V, and more. As the clouds part, Eevee's Evolutions appear in a full rainbow of Pokémon V and Pokémon VMAX to signal a bright new day in Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Evolving Skies!

Over 200 cards

18 powerful Pokémon V and 15 enormous Pokémon VMAX

Dragon-type Pokémon return with a new look

More new Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards

24 Trainer cards and a new Special Energy card

—description from the publisher

Name: One-page Che Guevara: el fracaso boliviano 1967
Description:
Area-movement print-n-play game, ostensibly for 2 players (but probably best solitaire) set during Che Guevara's 1967 insurgency in Bolivia. To win, the guerillas must eliminate the 8 Bolivian army divisions within eight one-month turns, while the Bolivian government must eliminate the Che guerilla unit. Bolivian army divisions cannot leave their regions, but from turn 5, the Bolivians gain one mobile Ranger unit per turn. A variety of optional rules provide much variety to play.
The game consists of an A4 board, 31 counters and one double-sided A4 sheets of rules, optional rules and historical background.

—description from the designer

Name: Miód
Description:
A short and simple family game in which players compete to be first to create honey in their apiaries. The winner is the person who will gain more points from the honey and nectar tokens at the end of the game.

Linden, heather or multi flower? What is your favorite honey? You will win if your bees will result the most hardworking and produce more honey.

The set up is very fast and simple: each player receives 2 beehive cards which should be put in the player’s area and 3 starting bees cards which should be put on the left from the beehives.
The game is played in rounds which are divided into the phases. Firstly, each player receives 3 cards which should be assigned to the following actions: putting nectar tokens into the meadow card; collecting nectar tokens from the meadow and moving the nectar tokens into the bees cards which are next to the beehive. The player who will be the first in filling 2 beehives with nectar tokens is the winner.

Name: Tales of Vespershard
Description:
Tales of Vespershard (ToV) is a miniatures skirmish game (32mm) with a fantasy aesthetic. It is based on the Uud universe, created by the Eldritch Foundry. The Vespersdhard represents the ability players have to shape their own universe.
We provide the story and a basic background. The players can use that to come up with any new adventure, story, and campaign, changing and adapting it totheir ideafor a fast and fun miniatures game.

You want an elven-forged empire which has subdued all other races? Or do you want dragons easily upholding the plains? Or maybe for nightmares to come true at night and hunt down the unwary? Well, you can make all this a reality in ToV.

Many things are customizable at the rules level (scenery, campaigns, enemies ...), but you can also customize the miniatures for your gang thanks to the powerful Eldritch Foundry app, an indispensable collaborator for our project.

Fight against your friends in dynamic battles between gangs, with a narrative touch and with heroes designed by you. Evolve your gang and link scenarios to create your own narrative campaign.

—description from the designer

Name: Mahanadi
Description:
You are working together to save a life-giving river and its ecosystem. For each one of us, It is not just flowing water, but a deep connection to our being. How will we all work together to save it from contamination?

The players are specialists in their own right taking unique roles with the knowledge and the power that they bring in to save the situation and find a solution. A separate deck of cards for the abilities and contamination levels and land and river tiles for the various zones make up the components of the game.

Players use cards and place tiles to move around the board. The game ends when the last contaminated zone tile has been removed.

Players must together plan their strategy to mesh with their expert's strengths in order to prevent contamination. For example, the Tribe head can identify and find cures for ecosystem contamination, and the bio-Scientist needs only four cards of particular contamination to cure it instead of the normal five—but the contamination is spreading rapidly and time is running out.

If contamination spreads beyond recovery or if too much time elapses, the players all lose. If they stop and regenerate the ecosystem, they all win!

Name: Arena Brutalis
Description:
Arena Brutalis is a miniature wargame where players battle in a arena with futuristic war machines and weapons. Players can customize their team, select and swap unique weapons and equipment in game, pose their minis, and fight for glory! Miniatures are 3d printed at home and designed to have articulation with customization capability. This unique system was engineered and tested to create the most immersive and robust tabletop game in the world (big claim). It's fun, it's funny, it's ridiculous, it's Arena Brutalis!

First released in 2020, the 2nd edition features updated rules.

go to www.arenabrutalis.com to find out more!

Name: Unicorn Stew: Trolling the King Promo Card
Description:
Order Card:
Play when doubles of any dish are played. Discard one of the doubles.

Card included in GTM Magazine #259

Name: White Washers
Description:
A fun money laundering card game of deception and deduction for 3-5 degenerates.

A group of people get their hands on a fair amount of dirty money. To be able to use it, they decide to launder it together through 5 businesses. The best idea turns messy when each one secretly decides to dupe the other and keep the load of it for themselves. Who will outwit whom and walk away with a cartload of clean money? Play to find out. Play the others to win.

On their turn a player offers a card from their hand to another player and tells them limited information about the card. The other player then decides whether to accept or decline. Some cards are bad and others are good. If the player accepts they will then add the card to their face-up cards for end game scoring. Of they decline, the player who offered the card will place it in their face-up area.

The player who gains the most points from their cards wins the game.

Name: Nebula Rush
Description:
Nebula Rush is a game of exploration on continuously changing game maps for 2 to 4 players.  Sail your Pirate Guild’s ships through The Whirly Swirly Neb, gathering resources, avoiding storms and gales, and collecting clues and rumors as to the location of “The Kracken’s” hidden treasure.  A game that is Half Sleuth game, Half Exploration, and Half Combat, Nebula Rush keeps you on the edge of your seat as you race to search, locate and claim "The Kracken's" treasure.

On each turn, players either draw a Ship Appearance Card (which can put the ship and any player's game board) or keep their ship out of play. The you fight, draw treasure and rumors, buy items for your ships and discard resource cards if necessary.

All players start with 3 Ships in their Guild totaling a Manifest value of 13. If the Player has more Befallen Cards + SRS Resource Cards in their hand than their Guild's Manifest value, they discard to the Manifest value.

When a Player has a completed one of the multiple Treasure Maps AND has one of their Ships in the System Hex of the completed Treasure Map, they claim "The Kraken's" Treasure and become Master of The Neb.

The primary means for the player to win is to claim "The Kraken's" Treasure. Other ways to win are to eliminate all other Player Ships, or to have all 6 Legendary Captains (a type of Befallen Card) on each of their Ships.

Name: Skåne (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description: Skåne is the southernmost part of Sweden. Game rules are the same as Ticket to Ride Europe.

Name: Village Pillage: À L'Abordage
Description:
Village Pillage - A L'Abordage is a stand alone game with new villagers, but also pirates to help you become the king!

To become the king, you will have to acquire 4 relics. 
In this lawless world, everything is paid for in turnips, including the precious relics that are essential to your royal victory. With the same villagers as the other players, you will have to make the difference and play skillfully against your table neighbours. During the game, you can recruit new villagers for more powerful effects. Add pirates to the game to enjoy even more powerful effects... and risky ones!

Name: Jungle speed + Jungle speed électronique
Description:
In Jungle Speed, you must rely on your keen sense of observation and quick reflexes. It requires a steady hand -- which can be hard to maintain during the many fits of maniacal laughter! The wooden Totem sits in the middle of the table, waiting for the player with the fastest reflexes to snatch it up and win the game.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards. In order to win you must be the first player to get rid of all of your cards. Each turn, all of the players reveal one of their cards. If two cards are identical, those players must make a grab for the Totem. The faster player then gives their cards to their unfortunate adversary.

To add to the difficulty, certain cards are almost identical, which can trick a hapless player into grabbing the Totem by mistake -- a grave error. Other cards force all players to make a grab at once, change the method of play, or otherwise add to the difficulty.

Jungle Speed Electronique keeps the familiar game play elements from Jungle Speed: Players reveal cards from their individual stacks one at a time, and whenever two players have identical cards face-up in front of themselves, they race to grab the totem first. Whoever does so gives his cards to the slowpoke. The first player to rid himself of cards wins.

What's new in the electronic version of this game is the totem will give you directions from time to time that change the nature of game play – some of which might lead you into doing the wrong thing! Jungle Speed Electronique includes three levels of game play with a dozen special actions programmed into the totem.

Name: Sushi Mania
Description:
Sushi Mania is a real-time, simultaneous, competitive game. Each player represents a Sushiman trying to deliver their orders, the best they can, accordingly to the sushis still available.

Players must simultaneously draw cards from the deck, each card representing an order. The orders show the sushis to be taken from the global repository, temper them with Shoyu or Wasabi when needed. Once complete, they draw a new order. The game ends when there's no new order, or no available sushi. The player who fulfilled more orders is the big winner.

Be fast and use strategy to achieve the best combination before others do!

Name: Unserjass
Description: UnserJass (OurJass) is a 2 player Jass game that brings together elements of Bela, Handjass, Jo-jotte, as well as some new ideas. The goal of the game is to score game points (1-2 per hand) by bidding for the trump suit and then successfully carrying out your bid during the hand.

Name: Postcard Tobruk
Description:
A very fast and simple (but subtle) minimalist rendition of the 5 (possible) major battles around Tobruk during World War 2, Jan 41-Nov 42.
Basically brigade to division to (Italian) corps level.
Indeterminant time periods but 4-7 turns.
Unique rules regarding armored/panzer vs. (Disrupted) infantry units, and Rommel (with a desert/fennec fox) is on the scene to chase the desert rats.
Pressed Attack/Desperate Defense combat options.

Anyone - including schools and libraries - is free to print this off in A6/4"x6" or A5/5"x8" format in as many copies as you like and send them to family and friends who might be interested ... as long as you keep my copyright statement, its Dedication, and my history quotes.  All other publication rights, including/especially for large, conventional boxed format are reserved to me for licensing.

It is advisable to photocopy/enlarge the front to A4/11"x17" for an optimal piece size and to A3/11"x17" for optimal map size.  You can enlarge the rules as much as you need to.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Deutsches Volkstrachtenspiel
Description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 60 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The Supplement edition was printed in a magazine - most likely "Onkel Antons Kinderkalender" - had the same board design and came with cut out meeples.

Name: Verba Volant, Scripta Manent
Description:
Liar's Dice with letter cards. The first player draws 5 cards and announces a word of 4 letters or less that they claim is in their hand. The next player either accepts or refuses.

- If they accept they get the whole hand of cards, discard a card and draw two cards, and claim a word in their hand longer than the previous one, and the next player must accept or refuse.

- If they refuse the hand is exposed. If the claimed word is in it, the person who claimed the word gets 1 point per letter in the word. If it isn't, the challenger gets those points. Either way, the hand is discarded and the next player starts the process again with a new 5-card hand.

- The first player to 25 points wins.

Name: Sisu: Battles for Suursaari Island 1942 & 1944
Description:
Suursaari, also known as Högland, Gogland, or ‘the Great Island’, is a large island in the Gulf of Finland. In 1942 and again in 1944 it was the focal point of a battle. The island is centrally located, perfect for dominating sea lanes leading to Leningrad or those crossing between Finland and Estonia. Float planes, or ski planes in winter, could use it as a base; strings of minefields could be monitored from it; coastal guns placed on it could engage passing ships. Immediately before World War II the island belonged to the Finns. It was a rustic vacation destination, complete with casino. The Russians acquired the island without a fight during the Winter War of 1939/40. In the winter of 1942, the Finns took it back from the Russians. In September 1944 the Germans tried and failed to take it from the Finns. This game comprises two scenarios covering these battles, using a common set of rules.

Scale is 300 meters across a given hex. Contour lines are 20 meter intervals. Since the 1942 battle took place in winter and the 1944 battle took place in summer, each scenario uses its own map. The military units are sections (squads), platoons, and companies. Other counters represent batteries of artillery and mortars, naval craft, individual commanders, and bunkers. Each player’s military forces must manoeuvre across the game board, attacking the opposing force with direct and indirect fire, airstrikes, naval gunnery, and fighting hand-to-hand. One player is the Defender and the other is the Attacker. The Attacker must achieve his objectives before time runs out. The longer the game goes on, the more objectives he must achieve to win. Turns are one hour. Special rules include snow storms, the Finns attacking across the ice in winter, German naval landings using barges and assault boats, naval gunfire by flak barges and a destroyer squadron, airstrikes, variable visibility due to terrain, weather, and time of day, antitank guns that can fire HE in an indirect role, and much more.

In the 1942 scenario, the Finns attack across the ice in a blinding snowstorm against a reinforced Soviet battalion of half-frozen men, some of whom nevertheless resisted for 3 days. In the 1944 scenario the Germans fail in their attempt to bluff the Finns into handing over the island peacefully, land a motley force including worn-out infantry, coastal artillery personnel, 88mm flak guns with no ammunition, and 580 men of Marine-Artillerie-Abteilug 531. The 531st was no sedentary coastal garrison, but a special commando unit whose men took part in the very first battle of the war, the assault on the Westerplatte at Danzig on 1 September 1939. The Finns defeat them all, just in time to hand the island over to the Soviets as part of the Armistice agreement.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: "Afflicted" Expansion Deck
Description: This 18-card expansion pack and PDF reference guide allow a player to become the "Afflicted" of Salem and accuse other players of witchcraft, unleashing angry mobs on the hunters.

Name: Army of the Rhine: Ombre de Turenne – The War of the Grand Alliance on the Rhine, 1688-1697
Description:
Army of the Rhine is the fourteenth volume in Red Sash Games’ Lace Wars series. This game is the last in a set of four dealing with the War of the Grand Alliance (1688-1697). This war, sometimes called the War of the League of Augsburg or the Nine Years' War, was the second of the three great wars of Louis XIV.

As a young man he waged the Dutch War to expand France’s borders. That was a war of aggression. As an old man he fought the War of the Spanish Succession to put his grandson on the throne of Spain. Despite the King’s ultimate aim, that was a defensive war. The War of the Grand Alliance was Louis’ war of middle age – a war of grinding attrition involving nearly a million men. There was not even supposed to be a war, only a demonstration of France’s power. France was engaged in a long process of securing her eastern and northeastern frontiers. Louis felt his prestige was on the line when some of his German neighbours – specifically the Elector Palatine and the good burghers of Cologne – refused to give him what he wanted. A strong message needed to be sent. Also, by taking military action the French would put heart into the Turks, who were fighting a losing battle against the forces of the Holy League; keeping the Ottoman Empire in the game would ensure the Holy Roman Emperor could not support the minor powers who were the real object of King Louis’ wrath. But, things did not go as planned. 
  
In Army of the Rhine, you will have a chance to change history – and perhaps you can win enough glory to write your name in the history books. As the Allied commander you lead a motley collection of troops. They are nearly all German, but that means very little. In the Empire, a prince only contributes greatly to the Cause if he expects to be greatly rewarded; otherwise, he will contribute as little as he thinks he can get away with. And, because the princes have the option to aid either Emperor Leopold or King William of England, they can play the one off against the other without being accused of letting the side down. Vienna may tell you to expect 30,000 men from Brandenburg, only to learn their Elector has chosen to fight in Brabant this year, because King William paid him in advance. And as for expecting help from the Emperor himself, forget it. French passivity in the face of your outstanding defense of the frontier last year has given him the excuse to siphon away yet more resources to his never-ending Hungarian war.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: United Colonies Expansion Deck
Description: This 18-card expansion pack allows a player to become Benjamin Church and his rangers. These men are skilled at hunting the supernatural.

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: Werewolves Expansion Deck
Description: This 18-card expansion pack and PDF reference guide add NPC werewolves and a new scenario to games of Devil in the Wilderness.

Name: NIN
Description:
The world of Nin places you as a Ninja master vying to control more castles than your opponents.

To aid you in this quest, your clan has mustered their nine best Ninjas - each with their own unique ability.

However, the winds whisper about how the other clans have also
mustered their best Ninjas to meet you in the field of battle. Therefore,strategic placement and impeccable timing is essential to outmaneuver your opponents.

In this game players take turns to play / reveal one of their Ninja cards as an attempt to control castles. When all players have passed, the game ends and check who is controlling each castle. The player who controls the most castles wins the game.

The game includes 2 game variants, team variant and advanced variant. The Team variant allows players to play in teams (but must be played with 4 players) while the advanced variant gives players more depth by adding a new action to the game, Delay.

Name: Precision Handball
Description:
A possession by possession statistical replay simulation of handball using cards and dice.

The outcome of each possession is determined by rolling 4 dice; two d6 and two d10. The two d6 tell you the type of outcome, the two d10 tell you whether that outcome resulted in a goal, a miss or a save.

A complete game will take around 90 die rolls to complete, so easily playable in an hour.

Men's and women's Olympic, World and European championships are available as well as national leagues.

Name: Helden Handwerk
Description:
In Heroescraft, you are the governor of one of the cities of the legendary land of Nidawellir. Mighty heroes are at your service, with whose tactical use you expand the economic influence of your city. Command your heroes skillfully and erect magnificent buildings that will give you both power and fame.

In this exciting, interactive economic strategy game, two to four players compete for supremacy in the region. With clever actions, the players try to get useful resources to expand their cities - often at the expense of their neighbors.

Recognizing the plans of your competitors and thwarting them at the right time for your own benefit - therein lies the key to success in Heroescraft!

Because only those who make the best use of the skills of the heroes and the special privileges of the buildings will win the gripping competition for raw materials, reputation and power!

In order to win, the players must erect a certain number of buildings. Buildings are built by giving up certain raw materials. Raw materials can either be bought in the cities adjacent to the caravan. Or they can be exchanged with the players or with the bank through different heroes. When buying raw materials, the dynamic prices in the market must be taken into account.

Name: System Update 2021 (fan expansion for Android: Netrunner)
Description: System Update 2021 is a set of over 80 classic Netrunner cards, reprinted with updated NISEI rules and templating and brand-new original illustrations. It is designed as the perfect follow-up purchase for anyone who wants to dive deeper into the game after experiencing System Gateway.

Name: ジュリアーノ王子の貢ぎ物 (Prince Juliano's Tribute)
Description:
ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ¼ãƒŽçŽ‹å­ã®è²¢ãŽç‰© (Prince Juliano's Tribute) is a board game from Japan. Prince Juliano wants to show his love for the princess. She asks for a necklace to be crafted, one part each month, before she will marry the prince.

Players are jewellers in the kingdom, tasked with keeping the princess happy by putting together the clusters of jewels she demands. The players work together, buying jewels, rolling the dice to find out she wants, and then assembling the necklace. If they do well, the princess gets happier, but if they fail then her mood falls. Over 12 rounds, can the players keep her sufficiently pleased to marry the prince?

The game comes with lots of jewels, gold coins and a long presentation box to assemble the pieces.

There is also a variant to make the game more competitive.
user summary

Name: AngerSmash: The Viciously Addictive Card Game
Description:
AngerSmash is a strategic, set-building card game of bluff, theft & cooperation. Create a cocktail of Anger and Zen to floor your opponents, all the while under constant attack from your opponents.

- Race to build sets of anger and zen cards.

- sabotage your opponents or team up to destroy them.

- Smell victory then watch as it's snatched away.

- High strategy, low cunning and a little bit of luck!

Improve your position round by round, but don’t ignore what your opponents are doing. You must undermine their plans, steal from them and make their blood boil.

How to win: Be the FIRST to build a set of 4 identical Anger cards & a set of4 identical Zen cards. This is called an ANGERSMASH.

But you must prevent other players from achieving ANGERSMASH before you! BloodBoilers let you steal cards from other players. Disruptors give you special powers.

Name: Mission d'espion
Description: The goal of the game is to find all the clue hidden hidden in the house by a person that will manage the game.  Each a the clue will point the "spy" toward the place where the next clue will be hidden.  With some of the clues you will also add mathematic or logical puzzle that the spy will have to solve in order to stop a bomb from blowing.

Name: Roll Mon
Description:
Roll Mon is a TCG (Trading Cube Game) for 2 players
Each player build a team (2 units) including 5 special cards that come with units you choose.

Players control units by flipping the cube to do a action After flip the cube. Face of cube that face up will take action. Each unit's cube have very own unique ability: some can draw card very fast some can attack very heavy  some can use skill and more.

A player wins the game by reducing the opponent HP units to 0.

Name: Frozen II: Splash Match
Description: Fill the game tray with water and try to pick up snowflakes with tweezers and try to collect a set before the timer/water Nokk (horse) pops up.

Name: A Clave de Candombe
Description:
Inspired by a well-known rhythmic base, characteristic of South America, the game proposes a gestural and sound dialogue on the constant key of candombe. It contains cards with images that suggest onomatopoeia and others that suggest slogans to energize the game.

Based on the candombe performed by all the players with their bodies, each one of them, identified by a card that assigns him mimicry and onomatopoeia, must call out to other players without missing a beat.

Each player that misses a beat (and does not respond to its assigned name), gains a letter from Candombe. The game ends when one player gets all the Candombe letters, and the players with less errors win.

Promotes communication, attention and coordination are put into play in A Clave de Candombe.


A KEY TO CANDOMBE

On Sundays, in the Río de la Plata, slaves were allowed to rest and meet their relatives and friends, they “called” from one patio to another through the powerful sound of the drums. Thus they were in music, song and dance, to enjoy the meeting. In the rhythmic base of this musical species, the whole game is developed, that is to say that during a game everyone must repeat this sequence to accompany the game.

OBJECTIVE: Create a sequence of calls and audible responses (with onomatopoeia) without losing the rhythm that all the players do (key of candombe).

A card is dealt to each player in full view of all, which will have a gesture with a sound that will represent it. Once everyone has gotten into the rhythm of candombe, the game begins.

The rhythm must never stop!

Name: Steve Jackson's Sorcery! The Boardgame
Description:
Steve Jackson's SORCERY! The Boardgame is a fantasy co-op adventure of exploration, tactical combat, and decision-making set in the SORCERY! universe. The game takes a band of unusual heroes through the unique lands of the Shamutanti Hills, revisiting all the iconic locations and enemies of the choose-your-own-adventure book classic, adding and expanding on the original universe with the addition of locations, characters, and quests.

Players pick hero characters from Dragon Knight to Charlatan, each with their own deck of action cards. These cards are then used to overcome obstacles by activating a range of keyword actions such as jumping, manipulation, spotting hidden elements, or stealth. The same cards contain a wide range of combat maneuvers that can be played in battle to thrust, stab, cut, breathe fire or sidestep enemies, cast spells, or support other players. The game encourages and facilitates group play since heroes will have to support each other with action cards in order to gain the most from each other’s actions and abilities.

Every location the heroes visit is set up on the location board, allowing them to explore its secrets and interact with the many available location tiles and drawing from a range of possibilities in order to decide the best course of action for the group. Every location contains new challenges based on the core mechanics that are easy to understand and serve to create a variety of puzzles, dungeons, and other interesting places to explore.

Name: Old North
Description:
Old North is an area majority game for 2-4 players. Players battle to have the most influence points over several rounds of gameplay by maintaining the strongest loyalties to the four warring Houses in the North.

In Old North, you have no armies of your own. Instead, you maintain a court (or open hand) of five nobles belonging to the four Houses to manipulate and use their armies for your benefit.

Gameplay revolves around a central board containing six important regions in the realm. Occupying these regions are the armies of the four Houses, vying for control of each one. Over the course of the game, players score points for each noble in their court based on it's House's presence and control of the six regions. Controlling nobles in your court that belong to the most dominant Houses on the board will score you the most points - but comes at a cost.

On your turn, you will play a noble from your hand and perform one of over 30 unique actions and events. Playing a noble improves its House’s numbers and advantage on the board, but in turn removes its presence from your court – eliminating its ability to score points. On one hand, maintaining a court of nobles belonging to the most powerful Houses is the key to victory – but that means keeping them tucked away in your court, away from danger and unable to add to their House's strength on the board.

—description from the designer

Name: The Summoning of Kramdar
Description:
The Summoning of Kramdar: A strategy-based board game where players compete against each other to call forth an ancient demon of untold terror.

Players take turns to move towards the altar to make a sacrifice to Kramdar, or they can betray their fellow cult members by sending them instead. Players who make valuable offerings earn more points, while less worthy sacrifices may incur the wrath of Kramdar. Be warned, if an opponent can appease Kramdar, the player who sent them to the altar shall be banished to the Valley of Lost Souls. Whoever has made the most important sacrifices and has the most points by the end of the game is the winner.

A game of wits, deception and sacrifice!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deadzone: Mars Attacks Human Faction Deck
Description:
This deck enables you to field all of your Mars Attacks miniatures in Deadzone, as the Humans invade the Warpath universe!

It contains Mission cards, Battle cards, and stat cards for all of the miniatures from the Human faction.

Name: Conquer The Forest Path
Description:
Who will make it through the FOREST first?

Contents:
4 Player Pieces
1 Dice
52 Wooden game board pieces

Customizable game board means no two games will ever be the same.  Hidden obstacles and adventures await you at every turn!

The object of the game is to travel through the FOREST along the path of woden pieces.  The moves are made by rolling the dice to see how far you will move forward and by following the instructions on the wooden pieces with pictures of them.

Name: Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – High Noon at Gerzenburg Expansion
Description:
Corps Command: Dawn’s Early Light High Noon at Gerzenburg is a two-scenario expansion for Dawn's Early Light.

Includes:
- A new 11”x17” map 
- 40 new counters depicting the American 11th Armored Division, Airmobile troops from the 101st Airborne Division, the West German 27th Panzergrenadier Brigade, the Soviet 171st and 232nd Motor Rifle Brigades and the 23rd Guards Tank Division—a recon battalion and four regiments
- A battle report on the DEL scenario “The High Road” sets the stage for the continuing battle in High Noon at Gerzenburg

This expansion was released separately from the game and included in the Line of Fire Issue #10 and later incorporated into the 2nd edition Corps Command: Dawn's Early Light – Red Hammer game.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: Additional Witch Expansion
Description:
This 18-card Witch expansion pack makes it easier to play multiple witches in the core game. This pack will also give you the ability to add to your core deck, should you choose. By adding this pack to your core, you give yourself a chance to play the cards that work for you or the scenario you create in your game.

Most of the cards in this release are the same as the core Witch set; however, there are a couple of surprises.

Name: Devil in the Wilderness: Additional Witch Hunter Expansion
Description:
This 18-card Witch Hunter expansion pack makes it easier to play multiple witch hunters in the core game. This pack will also give you the ability to add to your core deck, should you choose. By adding this pack to your core, you give yourself a chance to play the cards that work for you or the scenario you create in your game.

Most of the cards in this release are the same as the core Witch Hunter set; however, there are a couple of surprises.

Name: Mary Anning
Description:
Follow in the footsteps of the 19th century English paleontologist and collect the best fossils as you excavate the dangerous cliffs of Lyme Regis.

A family friendly push your luck game inspired on the classic blackjack, with set a collection scoring mechanic and variable powers to spice up your games.

Players draw fossil cards from Lyme Regis' deck and add them to their excavation one by one. At the end of the round, the player who has come closest to 21 points, without going over, will be able to collect the fossil he wants from among all those played.

The game ends when one player fills all his boxes with fossils. It is time to evaluate the collections and determine which paleontologist deserves the victory.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: The Battle of Baltim: The Missiles turn on Egypt
Description:
A ready to play scenario based on the battle of Baltim, a missile boat engagement in the Yom Kippur war between Israel and Egypt.

Designed for use with SHIPWRECK, Vandering Publications d10 based wargames rules system for naval warfare in the age of the guided missile.  With a little modification could be used for other rules systems too.

Includes:

     A description of the action, results and long-term consequences.
     Ship detail sheets for all units involved.
     Instructions to set up the scenario, starting positions, victory conditions, variation rules, and a solo play option.


—description from the publisher

Name: Med andra ord: Pocket
Description:
The word-explaining game Med andra ord made portable in this card based version. The words are on cards instead of tokens, and are worth 1-3 points depending on the difficulty.

You play in pairs, where one has to explain the word on the card "in other words" and the other guesses. In 45 seconds, you should try to explain and guess correctly on as many cards as possible. When the game is over, the points are added up according to the denomination on the cards. The team with the highest score wins.
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Batman: Escape From Arkham Asylum
Description:
Batman: Escape from Arkham Asylum is a semi-cooperative dungeon crawl for 1 to 5 players in which the Super Villains of the Batman universe are the protagonists. This is one of the few games where you must defeat Batman, and that gives the player the opportunity to play as dozens of characters. The players will put themselves in the shoes of the most iconic Super Villains of Gotham City: The Joker, Harley Quinn, Two-Face, The Penguin, Bane, Poison Ivy, and The Scarecrow. The goal? Escape from an iconic institution of Gotham City: Arkham Asylum.

Batman: Escape from Arkham Asylum offers the funny and wild vision of the comics of the Batman universe and introduces a novel element: confronting Batman. Players must join forces to achieve their common goal. However, each one of them will have their own hidden objectives, which can range from escaping on their own or sowing as much chaos as possible in the asylum, something they must achieve to gain an advantage over their companions and be the one who finally wins the victory.

The players choose a Super Villain and play their turns one after the other. In each of these turns, the players can perform different actions such as moving around on the board, attacking their enemies with crazy weapons, searching rooms or crafting tools to use in their escape. The game ends when the players escape or when everyone is defeated by the forces of order that run Arkham, from the tough guards of the complex to, of course, the Dark Knight himself.

Name: Lukuset
Description:
Celebrate Finnish literature in this trivia game. Four categories of questions on your way to the finish.

Similar to Trivial Pursuit, players roll a die and move around the board, answering questions based on the colour of the square you land. The first player to reach the final square and answer the question correctly is the winner.

Name: Medvěd WRR: Poprask na kolejích
Description:
"Full steam ahead!" Engineer Crocs ordered his chums. They were busy with keeping the steel locomotive on the rails. The train was full of fairy-tale creatures who have become poor victims of Crocs' villainous plan. Can you save all the creatures before the train reaches its final station, as the WRR? Be quiet so Crocs doesn’t catch you!

MedvÄ›d WRR: Poprask na kolejích (The WRR: Railroad Mayhem) is a fast paced dice game based on the popular Czech book for kids.

The objective of the game is to gain and combine colored cars by rolling dice in a way they make one of the winning combos. The player to do so first wins.

Name: BirdSeed
Description:
BirdSeed is a card game from Japan. The game title is actually published as Bird$eed on the box front, and also as 'bird seed' in the game rules.

Players are roosters, trying to get food to score points. Getting sets of the same food scores best. Each rooster has a pair of favourite foods, and getting up to five of these adds points.

The food comes in three types, wheat, corn and nuts, in 1,2 or 3, or one of each. Cards showing a left wing, right wing and roosters are laid out, and three food cards dealt face-up to each one. Players then use card hands to win these food cards. Any food not collected stays in place and more food is added.

The players have hand cards to match the positions, and cards numbered 0,1,2,3 in different amounts. Players play three cards face-down, a place and two numbers to show which food pile they are going for and what number they bid. The numbers are added together and the game follows a butting process like Hols der Geier. But before the cards are assessed, any special combos take effect. So a pair, such as 11, gets you a free food card off the draw deck. A 00 gets you a food card from the player with the most.

Then players with a unique choice (left, right, centre) get their food. Then players with the same choice compare values. The highest value wins, but matching high values means the next highest wins, and so on.

At the end of the game, most points scored wins.
user summary

Name: Base
Description:
Base is a strategic, abstract puzzle game with a unique worker placement bid mechanism.

Grab modules and build your base! The goal of the game is to build as many rows and columns of 5 modules into your base following the given building instructions.

To get the necessary modules, you have to send trading delegations to neighbouring planets. As your fellow players will do the same, you should wisely choose the size of your delegation because size matters when it comes to trade negotiations. For each row or column that you accomplish within a round, you earn instant points that give you special actions. After 6 rounds, the game ends.

Now it’s time to score the secret side contracts that each of you signed with the private sector. The player with the most points wins the game and gets governor of his own planet.

Name: Stop the Robots
Description:
The chief of the special unit is calling you on a walkie-talkie: "We have a massive problem! A mad scientist has dumped crazy robots in the city! You are the only ones who can stop this threat. I will connect you with your partner on site in a moment. Together you have to deactivate the robots. Hurry up! Time is running out!"

In Stop the Robots, you must communicate with your partner on site to look through the robot cards and figure out which robot you are dealing with. Solve the tricky puzzles and tell your partner which wires to cut in order to deactivate the robot!

Name: Totta vai tarua?
Description:
Can you spot the real items from the made up ones? Start your inner lie detector.

Everyone takes turns to be a reader, reading one card of six items on any given category. Other players use tokens to mark whether they think those are real or fake. Points are tallied, and after equal number of turns, highest score wins.

Name: Irmandinhos
Description:
"In the middle of the s. XV in Galiza several power struggles took place in different regions. The warring factions acted in order to gain sufficient influence to gain control of these regions.

The Marshal will move through the different regions and determine in which territory the revolt will take place while the 3 factions position their followers to stand in front.

Irmandinhos is a board game of political and military intrigue that takes place during the final period of the Second Irmandiña Revolt (1469) in which three players will assume the role of different important characters and will have to make secret decisions for the three factions to make. Control each of the regions in play according to your character's goals.

After completing the six rounds, the player with the most goals accomplished will be the winner."

The players program actions in a hidden way through the intrigue cards, choosing the order in which they will be carried out to try to make a certain faction obtain a greater presence in the territory where the battle takes place. These territories will vary during the game. The player who manages to meet the requirements set by his character card before the 6 rounds will be the winner of the game.

Name: Monster Olympics
Description:
Build your monster’s strength, speed, and scare to compete for the gold medal in the Monster Olympics!

The game is played over 15 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by earning medals and advancing your monster as far as possible. All players will use the same dice pool for each roll, however each player determines how to use the dice.

In each round, you will roll 2 dice and then use those dice to determine which monster upgrade to use. Each monster upgrade advances certain tracks. At the end of the game, you will compare your Strength, Speed, and Scare to see who had the most in each category. You will also score your track with the lowest number.

Scoring - Medal Ceremony

You will compete in three contests consisting of Strength, Speed, and Scare. First, compare your number on the tracks with every other player. The player with the highest number on each track earns the Gold Medal, 7 points, and writes a 7 in the Scoring area under the Strength icon. The player with the next highest score earns the Silver Medal, 3 points. The next highest earns the Bronze Medal, 1 point. It is friendly scoring, so ties are shared.  Then check your individual four tracks, and write the lowest number in the last scoring area. Add your score and the player with the highest score is the Monster Olympics Champion!

Name: Word Fever
Description: The challenge in Word Fever is clear: one topic, one letter, and a word that starts with that letter in that topic. "Name something that didn't exist one hundred years ago and that starts with I." Find a solution quickly — "Internet!" — and be the first to hit the buzzer. The faster you answer, the more points you can win.

Name: Tanzania
Description:
Tanzania is a card game that will immerse you in the heart of Africa. Carnivorous animals, herbivores, herds and hunters will be the protagonists of a challenge full of threats, strategy and emotion.

In this game, each participant must avoid all the threats present to make their animals survive in the African savanna.


Objective: Be the first player to save 20 animals.

Contents: 50 animal cards, 35 situation cards, 35 hunter cards, 1 hand token, 1 regulation.

TANZANIA is a semi-cooperative card game.

Animal cards are dealt to each player and a situation card is raised (Day in the open field / Sunset at the river / Night in the grasslands).

Then an animal card is played trying not to lose it. When playing a carnivore you have to hunt. When playing a herbivore you have to avoid being hunted.
Each animal card has a score according to the situation card previously drawn.

By playing the same card as another participant, a pack is formed, increasing the score of the cards that comprise it.

Despite having stronger cards and weaker cards, the fact of forming a pack and playing as a team equates the weakest with the strongest.

At the end of the hand a hunter card is raised. In case one comes out, he hunts the strongest animal on the table, modifying the outcome of the round.

The strategy of the game is to know when to play each animal, since by playing a weak card you run the risk of being hunted by another animal and by playing a strong card you run the risk of being hunted by a hunter.

The first player to save 20 animals wins the game.
